TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit LongValidatorAttribute extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttribute

Docs.summary: Declaratively instructs the .NET Framework to perform long-integer validation on a configuration property. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use the LongValidatorAttribute attribute to decorate a configuration property. This is to instruct the .NET Framework to validate the property using a <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidator> object and pass to it the value of the decorating parameters.
You can apply the LongValidatorAttribute attribute to property types only.
## Examples The following example shows how to decorate the properties of a custom <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection> object using the LongValidatorAttribute attribute.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#7](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.configuration.l_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#7](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.configuration.l_0_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You use this constructor in the attributed model to ensure that the value assigned to the related property is a long integer.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to include or exclude the integers in the range defined by the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MinValue%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue%2A> property values.
Docs.value: if the value must be excluded; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The range is inclusive of the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MinValue%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue%2A> property values. When the ExcludeRange property value is `false`, the allowed values are outside the range.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.IntegerValidatorAttribute.ExcludeRange%2A> property.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#7](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.configuration.l_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#7](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.configuration.l_0_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value allowed for the property.
Docs.value: A long integer that indicates the allowed maximum value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The MaxValue property value is included in the allowed range.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the MaxValue property.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#7](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.configuration.l_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#7](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.configuration.l_1_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The selected value is less than <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MinValue%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value allowed for the property.
Docs.value: An integer that indicates the allowed minimum value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The MinValue property value is included in the allowed range.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the MinValue property.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#7](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.configuration.l_2_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#7](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.configuration.l_2_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The selected value is greater than <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets an instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You use the ValidatorInstance property value to perform string validation by calling its <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidator.Validate%2A> method.
